result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called 15CF333, 16CF14, 16CF30. Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court, in custody with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer on case 15CF333 and with Attorney Jaclyn Shelton on 16CF14 and 16CF30.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Shelton is heard - Repeater allegation in both cases 16CF14 and 16CF30 were stricken, incorrect in PSI, Court makes note of the change.  Atty. Klomberg agrees that there are no repeater allegations.  Atty. Klomberg states victim rights compliance.  1:09 pm, Atty. Klomberg begins argument.  1:44 pm - Atty. Fischer is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Shelton is heard on recommendation 1:59 pm.  Break 2:06 pm.  Resume 2:15 pm.  Christopher Skalitzky makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

15CF333 Count 1:
7 1/2 years DOC;
3 1/2 years IC,
4 years ES with conditions:
Treatment as required by agent,
pay costs/surcharges/dna/supervision fees
absolute sobriety
rabndom urinalysis
no violent contact with anyone.
151 days presentence credit

Court recommends that he be admitted into substance abuse program (would like on JOC).

16CF14:
4 years DOC:
2 years IC,
2 Years ES, 
Concurrent to sentence in 15CF333.
152 days presentence credit.

16CF30:
Count 1:
4 years DOC:
2 years IC,
2 Years ES, 
Concurrent to sentence other sentences.

Count 6:
90 days DCJ concurrent to all other sentences; this is a time served sentence for JOC.

Count 12:
90 days DCJ concurrent to all other sentences, this is a time served sentence for JOC. 

173 days presentence credit.
Sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Called cases 15CF333, 16CF14, 16CF30. Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court, in custody with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer for case 15CF333 and Attorney Jaclyn Shelton for cases 16CF14 and 16CF30.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews PQ&WOR, charges and penalties. Def pleads NC to ct. 1 Manuf/Deliver in case 15CF333.  Def pleads NC  to ct. 1 Bail Jumping w/o repearter in case 16CF14. Def pleads  NC  to ct. 1 Bail Jumping w/o repeater, NC to  ct. 6 Criminal Damage to Property , and NC to  ct.12 DC w/o enhancer in case 16CF30. Court finds factual basis, finds pleas made FV&K, accepts pleas and finds def guilty of ct. 1 in  15CF333, finds def guilty of ct 1 in 16CF14, and finds def guilty of ct's 1, 6, 12 in case 16CF30. All other counts are DRI. Court orders PSI to be submitted by 6-22-16 and any defense PSI to be submitted by 7-22-16, and schedules sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on April 22, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 7, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

15CF333, 16CF14 & 16CF30 - Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court, in custody with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer and attorney Jaclyn Shelton.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fischer represents def on cases 15CF333 & 16CF14;  Atty Shelton represents def on case 16CF30.  Atty Shelton heard on bail modification in 16CF30, request lower cash bail and the no contact order lifted.  Atty Klomberg responds;  objects to bail modification, does not object to no violent or abusive contact with victim.  Atty Klomberg request the $50,0000 cash bail be ordered on all 3 cases.  Atty Fischer heard, joins in with Atty Shelton's request for cash bond modification.  Court heard, modifies bail to $7,000 cash bail to cover all 3 cases.  Court also modifies the no contact order to no violent or abusive contact.  All other conditions remain.  Court rescinds the court appointed attorney order in 16CF14.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher A. Skalitzky
Current: 216 W. Center St., c/o Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 02-22-2016)
Prior: 723 W. Lincoln Street - #7, Waupun, WI 53963

(15CF333 & 16CF14) Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court, in custody with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held on Atty Shelton's motion for withdrawal of counsel; Court approves and appoints Atty Joe Fischer; Court orders payment plan at $50/mo; prelim is reset  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

(12:52)Defendant Christopher A. Skalitzky in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton via video. Def is eligible for SPD services;  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000.00 cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
